intro: Voacanga africana var. auriculata, commonly known as the African ivory bean, is a tropical plant native to Central and West Africa. It is a deciduous tree belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers followed by elongated, woody pods containing several dark brown seeds. Its seeds contain alkaloids and have been used traditionally in various medicinal and ritualistic practices.
